text: Labirut is a small village in Bukhara region, Uzbekistan. The name Labirut is the combination of two words, Labi, which means the edge and rut which means a small canal. A small canal flows across the village, which gave the name to the village. The population of the village is about 500-1000 people. There is a big grapes garden, an apricot tree yard and a big cemetery. == References == Category:Populated places in Bukhara Region
title: Labirut
